comments: One of the best professors I\'ve had at BLS. Had him for both Corp. Finance and Property. Clear, concise, funny, and to the point. When people waste time on stupid topics, he steers the class back on point real quick. Expect to read your assignments, as you can get called on. Fair amount of reading. Know the material, and you\'ll do fine on the test.
Great professor. One of my top favs at BLS. Wish he taught more classes. Really clear, uses visuals. Very articulate. Funny, too. Highly recommend.

Professor Myers is a wonderful asset to Brooklyn Law and exactly what the school needs more of. He is clear, concise, intelligent, fun and engaging. It\'s an absolute pleasure going to his class and listening to his \r lectures. Clearly knows his stuff and clearly prepares for each class. Very concerned that students understand. \r Mumbles a bit,

Definitely a fan of Prof. Myers. Material was dry but he tried to make it interesting, and he was honest about which subjects were actually important in life. Final wasn\'t the most challenging but wasn\'t a breeze either... and there was more than one fact pattern.

Ignore the comment below. Myers was awesome. friendly, clear, and helpful. The final wasn\'t just on one topic you idiot. Perhaps that is why you felt you learned nothing. Myers is an asset to this school and I hope he stays. We need more friendly, smart, and young professors like him.

taught the class nothing--as in people should be refunded part of their tuition. comes across as very likable but slowly you realize that there\'s little substance. frequently let class out early--and quickly disappeared. exam was one topic and ridiculously easy, which means that no one was really tested fairly in the end. avoid for property.
